channel.title: DarkQuest Community!
channel.description:
--- I DID NOT CODE THIS SOURCE! THEREFORE I AM NOT TAKING CREDIT FOR WHO IT BELONGS TO --- Did you ever play DarkQuest? Notice how it was only up for a little while? Such a great server, gone so suddenly. This of course was over a year ago. I am not peeter or pets nor am I claiming their hard work as my own. I am Cody, and I am the owner of DarkQuest Community. If you want to come play, it's up 24/7 except some restarts for updates. The server has all skills working except Thieving and Agility. There is no set XP rate, as all skills are set differently. Do you like PKing/Staking/Monster Hunting? Getting 99 flats is definitely going to take more than a day or 2, so It's not something that can be done without effort. Do you like Skilling/Talking with other people? Come give it a try, who knows you might actually like it. The server is 2 days old already, so come catch up and take your spot. forgot to mention, most, if not all skills are batched by the load, once your full it stops. http://darkquest.sytes.net/index.php
Here is a compilation of pictures I quickly put together for you guys [IMG]http://i31.photobucket.com/albums/c354/GIR_DOG/dqpics.jpg[/img] sorry for the shitty picture, ill create a new one when i wake up ;)

item.title: DarkQuest Community!
item.dc:creator: @NoLives NoLives
item.description:
@NoLives wrote:

[quote="-Nothing, post:45, topic:434888"][quote author=NoLives link=topic=537608.msg3940332#msg3940332 date=1331377149]

Most of the work being yours is a huge exaggeration. You had to ask turkish idiot to add buy/sell/trade x, lulz.

It’s not a huge exaggeration. No one has contributed to the project more than I have.

What’s wrong with using the generated revenue to pay developers to improve the project? It’s not that I’m incapable of doing something, it merely allowed me to work on something else whilst he worked on it for $1 an hour pissing around with head-fuck client code. It still took a lot of work afterwards to get it right because I’m far more picky when it comes to perfection compared to Mark.

Maybe if RSCE had some competition we’d see a bit of improvement in the community.

You speak as if I’m preventing competition… It’s not my fault that no-one can compete, I welcome competition to be honest… It motivates me to get stuff done.
[/quote]Lets me honest, its a public secret that you’re behind the ddosing and that does quietly kill the community.

Anybody could DDoS, and I can tell you that Luke isn’t only one DDoSing around here(if he even does). There’s about 2-5 guys that have botnet in RSC community, and it’s very easy to get one, and it costs only about 30$ to get 300 bots, which means it’s very very easy to take down any RSC server other than RSCE, because usually they don’t have any kind of protection.[/quote]Yes, that is very clear to me that a few people have botnets, but, not many people have vested interest in new servers thriving.

Read full topic

item.title: DarkQuest Community!
item.dc:creator: @amfg amfg
item.description:
@amfg wrote:

[quote=“elyad, post:40, topic:434888”][quote author=amfg link=topic=537608.msg3939818#msg3939818 date=1331329407]

Luke has no need to to DDos any attempt of private servers that are released, Even if he was the one taking down servers, He’s doing the community a favour in getting rid of these servers that always end up unsecure, unstable & have a short life expectancy.

You have no idea what you are talking about… and

Logic error.

The reason why the community dies is people get fed up of wasting there time on these servers that have no potential life span.

Wrong.

Luke has had his server up for 2 years now, Its the longest running & most reliable secure server ever to be released upon the RSC community.

“his server” - Wrong.
Reliable - Wrong. It’s constantly experiencing downtime and even when it’s up the server needs to be restarted far too often… and remember when shops were broken for about a week and Luke had to pay someone to fix them? Lols.
Longest running - Correct.

If it was not for Luke i suspect the community would of been dead along time ago, Because you dont see anyone doing near as much as Luke has done.

Wrong, and it’s already been dead for a long time.

The community is split between there opinions of how Luke works, But if it wasnt for him you would not have a game to play. Show some appreciation.

Wrong.

RSCE sucks, it’s full of trolls and Finnish dickheads.
[/quote]

I can see by this reply you have no idea what you are talking about, And my points were 100% accurate.

Like Luke said, It is his Server, So some people may of helped with certain aspects of the game, But its still his Server.

As for the RSC Community, It is decreasing but it is not dead, And if it was not for RSCE then it would of been dead long ago.

Troll’s cant be helped, Thats how the internet community is nowadays, And so what, You should not let yourself get worked up about a kid trolling you.[/quote]

How is DDoSing “doing the community a favour”? The whole reason these servers are so short lasting is because of the attacks. Whoever is doing this is killing any gameplay outside of official RSC and RSCE. RSC is full of greedy jew stakers and RSCE is full of Finnish “hardcore PKer” twats, so the community has gone to shit. Maybe if RSCE had some competition we’d see a bit of improvement in the community.

Oh and see this:

-Nothing:

I think he meant that the RSC Community is pretty much dead for a long time, those players you have are most likely from RS2 and gold farmers.

Read full topic

Wait, how did this turn into an arguement?
The servers dead, why are you still here?

As for the RSC Community, It is decreasing but it is not dead, And if it was not for RSCE then it would of been dead long ago.

Troll’s cant be helped, Thats how the internet community is nowadays, And so what, You should not let yourself get worked up about a kid trolling you.

item.title: DarkQuest Community!
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

Kryptix:

[quote author=amfg link=topic=537608.msg3939818#msg3939818 date=1331329407]“his server” - Wrong.

It is my server? I’m the sole administrator, been here since day one, pay the bills, everything is in my name, most of the work is mine, how is it not my server?

Reliable - Wrong. It’s constantly experiencing downtime and even when it’s up the server needs to be restarted far too often… and remember when shops were broken for about a week and Luke had to pay someone to fix them? Lols.

It is reliable… I can’t remember the last time I last manually rebooted the server, I could go away for months and it would still be up. No other RSC private server has been able to do that.

Yes, it auto-restarts, but no-one can take it down and who cares about 30 seconds downtime once a day whilst it restarts?

I solely programmed the new shop system and the reason why it was down for so long is because I couldn’t find out how items were being created. As soon as I found out how it was fixed within minutes… It’s hardly advanced stuff so it just shows your stupidity in thinking I’d be incapable of doing something as simple as that. Who exactly would I pay? I wouldn’t trust anyone with the source, there’s no advantage to trusting anyone despite people nagging me to help daily.

Wrong, and it’s already been dead for a long time.

It’s hardly dead when 5,000 unique IP’s are logging in every week…[/quote]
I think he meant that the RSC Community is pretty much dead for a long time, those players you have are most likely from RS2 and gold farmers.

Read full topic

item.title: DarkQuest Community!
item.dc:creator: @elyad elyad
item.description:
@elyad wrote:

The DDosing community is bigger than ever now here, Back in 2007/08 when i was hosting Piru, The only person you had to worry about was Tewl. Now theres a bunch of kids who Ddos, Its not hard & you only had to do a minor bit of research to setup a Botnet, We could point the finger allday, Theres a bunch of kids who have nothing else to do who just feel the need to Ddos somebody. And these new servers being setup with the lack of security are easy targets for anybody. Hence why they get hit, But people are so quick to point the finger in Lukes direction, He does not need to attack these servers? There no competition to him.

Read full topic

I see, its Kryptix now instead of Tewl

item.title: DarkQuest Community!
item.dc:creator: @elyad elyad
item.description:
@elyad wrote:

[quote=“zen420, post:16, topic:434888”]Kryp-fish-dix is making himself into a joke in the rsc “community” by destroying it. Not only is he tyrannical enough to be fearful of ANY competition besides Real RSC, but he has continued to show that he doesn’t really care that he is becoming increasingly unpopular…

Not trying to provoke him or his minions, but c’mon… if I’m not mistaken RSCE is hosted from the USA, and Kryptix is against democracy of RSC PS’S…

I hope this server sticks around, but if it went away… it would just be another 1-3 week server that was 10x better than rsce or and RSCDaemon that may be coming out (HAPPY TROLLING) >>.<<[/quote]

Luke has no need to to DDos any attempt of private servers that are released, Even if he was the one taking down servers, He’s doing the community a favour in getting rid of these servers that always end up unsecure, unstable & have a short life expectancy.

The reason why the community dies is people get fed up of wasting there time on these servers that have no potential life span.

Luke has had his server up for 2 years now, Its the longest running & most reliable secure server ever to be released upon the RSC community.

If it was not for Luke i suspect the community would of been dead along time ago, Because you dont see anyone doing near as much as Luke has done.

The community is split between there opinions of how Luke works, But if it wasnt for him you would not have a game to play. Show some appreciation.

Read full topic

item.title: DarkQuest Community!
item.dc:creator: @plumpen plumpen
item.description:
@plumpen wrote:

it might just be someone from the RSCE community or someone who hates RSC servers. i believe kryptix on this one, why would he?

Read full topic

item.title: DarkQuest Community!
item.dc:creator: @Albatross Albatross
item.description:
@Albatross wrote:

[quote=“Outspoken, post:2, topic:435022”][quote author=Kryptix link=topic=537608.msg3938422#msg3938422 date=1331233188]

So, just to amuse us, speculate, if its not you, who else would even KNOW about the server that would profit from taking it down?

We’ve already established that it makes no difference to me whether it’s up or down. I rarely speak to anyone else in the scene so I have no idea, all my available time is being invested into RSCDaemon. People were attacked before I started messing around with private servers and people will still get attacked when I stop. Idiots like yourself have incredibly narrow vision and you can only see the most obvious and predictable option. Just because someone attacks Facebook doesn’t mean that it HAS to be the Twitter founder.
[/quote]

‘Idiots like yourself’ fail to see that you’re the only one with motive. Also, the reason you aren’t being listened to is because… I don’t know, maybe lying exists? Maybe because of your malicious past? Maybe it’s because you’re shady as fuck?

You stop being narrow minded and look from another point of view.[/quote]
I fail to see how Kryptix would be the only one with a motive to DDoS other servers. We talked about a server a couple months ago like RSChill that got DDoSed all the time and it turned out that a player from another competing server at the time (not RSCE) had been doing it from a single IP (could have been from multiples, w/e). The people that I see who would do shit like this are just people who want more players on the server they play on, whether it’s a random player or the admin of that server. I highly doubt Kryptix gives a shit at this point about a couple new servers coming out recently as he seems to be 100% focused on RSCDaemon.

The question could be asked is it a player from RSCE? Maybe, but that has nothing to do with Kryptix. It’s just getting old seeing people blame Kryptix for every single DDoS attack that goes on.

Read full topic

item.title: DarkQuest Community!
item.dc:creator: @Kryptix Kryptix
item.description:
@Kryptix wrote:

[quote=“Outspoken, post:5, topic:435022”]It’s part of your responsibility to keep your server online. If there’s nothing else that you can do to prevent your server going offline then you have fulfilled that responsibility. You’re still at blame for doing the best you can? Your logic baffles me…

Being at risk of another long post by you, I’m going to end it here and walk away. I’m just going to say, just because you try and twist logic doesn’t make that logic correct. Also it is factual in most cases of DDoS. Tewl was a perfect example of that…[/quote]
I’ll dumb it down in a way that you can understand.

If I’m hosting a RSC private server on my own PC and I get attacked by a single IP I should have the resources to fight it.
If I’m hosting a RSC private server on a dedicated PC and go through an attack that takes the game down but doesn’t eat up all the bandwidth I should be able to sort this with code optimisation.

If, however, I’m going through an attack so large that it takes Facebook down, there’s very little I can do without serious funding.

If he had more knowledge than he does he could keep the server online, but instead he has little to no knowledge and when the server goes down he simply just puts the blame on DDoS. If there’s literally nothing that can be done then fine, but there’s lots that can be done, he just doesn’t know how to do them.

Can you understand that or do I need to keep drilling it into your head?

Read full topic
